title: Numbers Chapter 35 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Numbers chapter 35 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Numbers Chapter 35 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Numbers Chapter 35.

questions.question: To whom did the LORD speak in the plains of Moab by Jordan near Jericho?
options: Moses
Aaron
Joshua
Caleb
questions.correctAnswer: Moses
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:1 states that the LORD spoke unto Moses in the plains of Moab by Jordan near Jericho.

questions.question: What were the children of Israel commanded to give to the Levites?
options: Cities to dwell in
Gold and silver
Livestock
Food offerings
questions.correctAnswer: Cities to dwell in
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:2 commands the children of Israel to give cities of inheritance to the Levites to dwell in.

questions.question: How far shall the suburbs of the cities given to the Levites extend from the wall of the city?
options: 1000 cubits
500 cubits
2000 cubits
3000 cubits
questions.correctAnswer: 1000 cubits
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:4 describes the suburbs around the cities as extending a thousand cubits round about from the city wall.

questions.question: How many total cities were given to the Levites including the cities of refuge?
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:7 states that the Levites were given forty-eight cities with their suburbs.

questions.question: How many cities of refuge were to be appointed for the manslayer?
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:6 and Numbers 35:13 clearly state that six cities were to be appointed as cities of refuge.

questions.question: Where were the six cities of refuge to be located?
options: Three on this side Jordan and three in the land of Canaan
All on this side Jordan
All in the land of Canaan
Two on each side of Jordan and two in Canaan
questions.correctAnswer: Three on this side Jordan and three in the land of Canaan
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:14 states the distribution of the six cities of refuge as three on this side Jordan and three in the land of Canaan.

questions.question: Who may flee to the cities of refuge according to Numbers 35:15?
options: Children of Israel, the stranger, and the sojourner
Only the children of Israel
Only the Levites
Only the priests
questions.correctAnswer: Children of Israel, the stranger, and the sojourner
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:15 explains that the cities of refuge are for the children of Israel, the stranger, and the sojourner among them.

questions.question: What is the punishment for a person who smites another with an iron instrument causing death?
options: The murderer shall surely be put to death
Exile to a city of refuge
A fine must be paid
Imprisonment for life
questions.correctAnswer: The murderer shall surely be put to death
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:16 states that if someone kills with an iron instrument, he is a murderer and shall surely be put to death.

questions.question: Who is called the revenger of blood in Numbers 35?
options: The person who kills the murderer
The priest
The king
The judge of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: The person who kills the murderer
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:19 states that the revenger of blood himself shall slay the murderer when he meets him.

questions.question: According to Numbers 35:25, until when must the slayer remain in the city of refuge?
options: Until the death of the high priest
For 40 years
Until the next festival
Until judged by the elders
questions.correctAnswer: Until the death of the high priest
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:25 states that the slayer must abide in the city of refuge until the death of the high priest.

questions.question: True or False: Numbers 35:30 states that one witness is enough to testify against a person to cause him to die.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:30 says that one witness shall not testify against any person to cause him to die; there must be more than one.

questions.question: True or False: Numbers 35:33 teaches that the land is defiled by bloodshed and can only be cleansed by the blood of the one who shed it.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:33 clearly states that blood defiles the land and it can only be cleansed by the blood of the one who shed it.

questions.question: True or False: The cities given to the Levites were only taken from those who had many possessions.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:8 states that cities were taken from those who had many and from those who had few, proportionally.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Numbers 35:11: 'Then ye shall appoint you cities to be cities of refuge for you; that the slayer may flee thither, which killeth any person at ______.'
options: unawares
anger
hate
willfully
questions.correctAnswer: unawares
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:11 uses the word 'unawares' to describe the circumstance under which the slayer may flee to the city of refuge.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Numbers 35:34: 'Defile not therefore the land which ye shall inhabit, wherein I dwell: for I the LORD dwell among the ______ of Israel.'
options: children
priests
elders
kings
questions.correctAnswer: children
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:34 says the LORD dwells among the children of Israel.

medium.title: Numbers Chapter 35 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Numbers Chapter 35 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Numbers 35 teach us about obedience and stewardship regarding God's provision?
options: The Israelites are instructed to give cities and surrounding lands to the Levites according to their inheritance.
The Levites must purchase their cities from the Israelites.
The Levites are to take cities from the Canaanites by force.
The Israelites are to build new cities exclusively for the Levites.
questions.correctAnswer: The Israelites are instructed to give cities and surrounding lands to the Levites according to their inheritance.
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:2-8 explains that the Levites are given cities and suburbs from the possessions of the Israelites, proportionate to each one's inheritance, teaching faithful stewardship and obedience to God's commands.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with fear after unintentionally causing harm to another. Based on Numbers 35, what biblical truth would you share about God's provision for justice and mercy?
options: God provides cities of refuge where the unintentional manslayer can find protection until judgment.
The manslayer must immediately pay a ransom to the victim's family.
All who cause harm must be put to death regardless of intent.
The manslayer must leave the land permanently.
questions.correctAnswer: God provides cities of refuge where the unintentional manslayer can find protection until judgment.
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:9-15 teaches that God commands cities of refuge for those who kill unintentionally, showing His mercy and justice by protecting them until they face judgment, encouraging believers to trust God's righteous provision.

questions.question: Which instruction in Numbers 35 teaches about the importance of fairness and proportionality in giving?
options: Giving cities to Levites according to the size of each Israelite's inheritance.
Giving equal amounts of land and cities to all Israelites.
Taking cities only from tribes with smaller inheritances.
Assigning cities to Levites based on their service in the tabernacle.
questions.correctAnswer: Giving cities to Levites according to the size of each Israelite's inheritance.
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:8 explains that cities are given to Levites from the possessions of the Israelites proportionate to their inheritance sizes, showing God's principle of fairness in stewardship.

questions.question: What spiritual discipline can be learned from the command to measure suburbs around cities for the Levites?
options: The importance of boundaries and order in community life.
The need to expand territory aggressively for growth.
The Levites' right to own land like other tribes.
The freedom to use land without limitation.
questions.correctAnswer: The importance of boundaries and order in community life.
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:3-5 describes measuring suburbs around cities to provide for cattle and goods, teaching believers the value of orderly stewardship and respecting God-ordained boundaries.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with anger after a wrongful accusation. According to Numbers 35, what biblical principle would you share about justice and patience?
options: The congregation must judge between the accused and the avenger, ensuring fairness.
The accused must be immediately punished without trial.
The avenger has the right to take revenge without oversight.
The accused should flee and never return.
questions.correctAnswer: The congregation must judge between the accused and the avenger, ensuring fairness.
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:24-25 teaches that the congregation judges between the slayer and the avenger to provide just treatment, encouraging believers to trust communal discernment and exhibit patience.

questions.question: How does Numbers 35 emphasize integrity in testimony regarding capital cases?
options: One witness is not enough to convict someone of murder.
A single witness can condemn a person to death.
Only family members can testify in capital cases.
Testimony is unnecessary if the victim's cause is clear.
questions.correctAnswer: One witness is not enough to convict someone of murder.
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:30 teaches that the murderer shall be put to death only by the testimony of multiple witnesses, underscoring the biblical value of honesty and thoroughness in judgment.

questions.question: What lesson about humility and contentment can be drawn from the command regarding the slayer remaining in the city of refuge until the high priest's death?
options: The slayer must accept temporary restriction for protection and justice.
The slayer is free to leave the city anytime.
The slayer can negotiate early release with the avenger.
The slayer is punished for life without hope.
questions.correctAnswer: The slayer must accept temporary restriction for protection and justice.
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:25-28 teaches that the manslayer must stay in the city until the high priest dies, showing humility and contentment in accepting God's appointed protection and justice.

questions.question: According to Numbers 35, what does the law about the revenger of blood teach us about forgiveness and reconciliation?
options: The revenger must not kill the slayer if he remains in the city of refuge.
The revenger should seek immediate revenge against anyone who harms.
The slayer must be permanently exiled.
The revenger can kill the slayer anywhere at any time.
questions.correctAnswer: The revenger must not kill the slayer if he remains in the city of refuge.
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:25-27 shows that if the slayer stays within the city of refuge, the revenger must not kill him, teaching the biblical principle of forgiveness and restraint until God's justice is fulfilled.

questions.question: How does Numbers 35 counsel believers regarding honesty and consequences in cases of murder?
options: The murderer shall be put to death without taking any ransom.
The murderer can pay money to avoid punishment.
The community can forgive the murderer if they repent.
The murderer should be exiled instead of executed.
questions.correctAnswer: The murderer shall be put to death without taking any ransom.
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:31 commands that no ransom or satisfaction shall be accepted for the murderer who is guilty of death, highlighting integrity and the seriousness of life in God's law.

questions.question: A believer is concerned about God's presence in their life and land. What teaching from Numbers 35 encourages faith and reverence toward God?
options: Do not defile the land because God dwells among the children of Israel.
The land belongs only to the Israelites and can be used freely.
God is far away and does not concern Himself with the land.
Pollution of the land is acceptable if it benefits the people.
questions.correctAnswer: Do not defile the land because God dwells among the children of Israel.
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:33-34 teaches that the land must not be defiled by bloodshed because God dwells among His people, encouraging believers to live with reverence and faithfulness.

questions.question: True or False: According to Numbers 35, the Levites were given cities without any surrounding suburbs for their cattle or goods.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:2-3 states that suburbs around the cities were given to the Levites for their cattle, goods, and beasts, showing God's provision and order for their needs.

questions.question: True or False: The cities of refuge were only for the children of Israel, excluding strangers and sojourners.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:15 clarifies that the cities of refuge were for Israelites, strangers, and sojourners, revealing God's inclusive mercy and justice.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Numbers 35, the murderer shall be put to death by the mouth of ________.
options: witnesses
priests
judges
avengers
questions.correctAnswer: witnesses
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:30 teaches that the murderer shall be put to death by the testimony of witnesses, emphasizing integrity and justice in judgment.

questions.question: How does Numbers 35 emphasize the importance of justice in distinguishing murder from manslaughter?
options: Intentional killing with weapons is murder and must be punished by death.
All killing is treated the same regardless of intent.
Manslaughter is always forgiven without consequence.
Killing with weapons of wood or stone is not punishable.
questions.correctAnswer: Intentional killing with weapons is murder and must be punished by death.
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:16-21 distinguishes murder (intentional killing with weapons) requiring death penalty, teaching believers about the seriousness of intent and God's justice.

questions.question: What practical Christian virtue can be learned from the command that the congregation judges between the slayer and the avenger of blood?
options: The virtue of impartial community judgment and reconciliation.
The virtue of personal vengeance.
The virtue of avoiding all judgment.
The virtue of individual punishment without community involvement.
questions.correctAnswer: The virtue of impartial community judgment and reconciliation.
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:24-25 emphasizes that the congregation judges impartially between parties, teaching believers to pursue fairness, patience, and reconciliation in community life.

hard.title: Numbers Chapter 35 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Numbers Chapter 35.

questions.question: What was the primary purpose of giving cities and their surrounding suburbs to the Levites according to Numbers 35?
options: To provide dwelling places and space for their cattle and goods
To establish military fortresses for protection
To create marketplaces for trade
To serve as religious pilgrimage sites
questions.correctAnswer: To provide dwelling places and space for their cattle and goods
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:2-3 explain that the Levites were given cities and their suburbs to dwell in, and these suburbs were for their cattle, goods, and beasts.

questions.question: How far did the suburbs extend outward from the city walls for the Levites' cities?
options: One thousand cubits
Two thousand cubits
Five hundred cubits
Three thousand cubits
questions.correctAnswer: One thousand cubits
questions.explanation: The suburbs of the cities given to the Levites were to extend one thousand cubits from the city wall (Numbers 35:4).

questions.question: How many total cities were given to the Levites including the cities of refuge?
options: Forty-eight
Forty-two
Six
Fifty
questions.correctAnswer: Forty-eight
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:7 indicates that the total number of cities given to the Levites was forty-eight, which includes six cities of refuge and forty-two other cities.

questions.question: According to Numbers 35, which group besides the Israelites could seek refuge in the cities of refuge?
options: Strangers and sojourners among them
Only the Levites
Foreign kings
Priests only
questions.correctAnswer: Strangers and sojourners among them
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:15 states that the cities of refuge were for the children of Israel, the stranger, and the sojourner among them.

questions.question: What is the legal distinction made concerning a person who kills another unintentionally versus intentionally in Numbers 35?
options: Unintentional killers may flee to cities of refuge; intentional murderers must be put to death
Both must flee to cities of refuge
Both must be put to death immediately
Only priests can judge the case
questions.correctAnswer: Unintentional killers may flee to cities of refuge; intentional murderers must be put to death
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:11-12 and 35:16-21 distinguish that the manslayer who kills unintentionally may flee to cities of refuge, but the murderer who kills with intent must be put to death.

questions.question: What role does the 'revenger of blood' have according to Numbers 35?
options: To kill the murderer if found outside the city of refuge
To protect the murderer in the city of refuge
To judge the case in the congregation
To serve as a priestly mediator
questions.correctAnswer: To kill the murderer if found outside the city of refuge
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:19 and 35:27 indicate that the revenger of blood is allowed to kill the murderer if he finds him outside the city of refuge where he fled.

questions.question: For how long must the slayer remain in the city of refuge before returning to their land?
options: Until the death of the high priest
Seven years
Until the next festival
Forever
questions.correctAnswer: Until the death of the high priest
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:25 and 35:28 specify that the slayer must remain in the city of refuge until the death of the high priest, after which he may return to his possession.

questions.question: How many cities of refuge were to be established on each side of the Jordan River?
options: Three on this side Jordan and three in the land of Canaan
Six on the east side only
Four on the west side only
Two on each side
questions.correctAnswer: Three on this side Jordan and three in the land of Canaan
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:14 specifies that three cities of refuge were to be on this side of Jordan and three in the land of Canaan.

questions.question: Which instrument of death definitively classifies a killer as a murderer according to Numbers 35?
options: An instrument of iron
Words spoken in anger
A wooden staff used for guidance
A stone thrown playfully
questions.correctAnswer: An instrument of iron
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:16 states that if a person strikes another with an instrument of iron causing death, he is a murderer and must be put to death.

questions.question: What is the significance of the command not to pollute the land with bloodshed as stated in Numbers 35?
options: Blood defiles the land, and only the blood of the one who shed it can cleanse it
The land is a temple and must remain holy
Pollution affects crop growth
It was a cultural taboo unrelated to law
questions.correctAnswer: Blood defiles the land, and only the blood of the one who shed it can cleanse it
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:33 explains that bloodshed defiles the land and that it can only be cleansed by the blood of the one who shed it, underscoring the seriousness of unlawful killing.

questions.question: True or False: According to Numbers 35, one witness is sufficient to convict a person of murder and sentence them to death.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:30 states that a murderer must be put to death by the mouth of witnesses, but one witness alone is not sufficient to testify against a person to cause death.

questions.question: According to Numbers 35, what is forbidden concerning taking satisfaction for a murderer?
options: No ransom or payment may be accepted to save a murderer from death
A murderer may be freed if a payment is made
Only priests may accept payment for a murderer
Satisfaction is accepted only from family members
questions.correctAnswer: No ransom or payment may be accepted to save a murderer from death
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:31 clearly states that no satisfaction (ransom) shall be taken for a murderer who is guilty of death; he must surely be put to death.

questions.question: What literary or theological significance does the death of the high priest have in the legal provisions of the cities of refuge?
options: It marks the release of the manslayer from the city of refuge
It signifies the end of the priesthood
It triggers a new cycle of sacrifice
It initiates the appointment of new judges
questions.correctAnswer: It marks the release of the manslayer from the city of refuge
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:25 and 35:28 show that the manslayer must remain in the city of refuge until the death of the high priest, after which he may return home, symbolizing a form of atonement and restoration.

questions.question: How does the provision of cities of refuge in Numbers 35 reflect broader biblical themes of justice and mercy?
options: They balance protection for the innocent with punishment for the guilty
They solely focus on punishment without mercy
They are meant to segregate Levites from others
They emphasize ritual purity over justice
questions.correctAnswer: They balance protection for the innocent with punishment for the guilty
questions.explanation: The cities of refuge provide a safe haven for unintentional killers, ensuring justice by protecting the innocent while also prescribing death for intentional murderers, reflecting God's justice tempered with mercy (Numbers 35:11-12, 16-21).

questions.question: What historical-cultural context in the ancient Near East does the role of the 'revenger of blood' in Numbers 35 parallel?
options: The custom of family members avenging wrongful death to maintain honor
A ritual cleansing process
A tax imposed on murderers
A priestly intercession
questions.correctAnswer: The custom of family members avenging wrongful death to maintain honor
questions.explanation: The 'revenger of blood' reflects the ancient Near Eastern practice where family members avenged the death of relatives, a social norm that Numbers 35 regulates within Israelite law (Numbers 35:19-21).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Numbers 35 commands that the cities of refuge be appointed so that the slayer may flee there and be safe from the __________ until judgment.
options: avenger of blood
priest
king
Levites
questions.correctAnswer: avenger of blood
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:12 clarifies that cities of refuge protect the slayer from the avenger of blood until he stands before the congregation for judgment.

theological.title: Numbers Chapter 35 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Numbers Chapter 35 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Numbers 35, what was the primary purpose of the six cities of refuge appointed among the Levites?
options: To provide shelter for manslayers fleeing accidental death charges
To serve as military fortresses against enemies
To act as centers for religious festivals
To be marketplaces for trading goods
questions.correctAnswer: To provide shelter for manslayers fleeing accidental death charges
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:6-15 clearly states that six cities were appointed as cities of refuge to which a manslayer who killed unintentionally could flee to escape the avenger of blood until judgment was passed. This concept is consistent with the provision of mercy in the law (Deuteronomy 19:1-13, Joshua 20:1-9) and foreshadows Christ as a refuge for sinners (Hebrews 6:18-20, Matthew 11:28-30).

questions.question: What measurement was given for the suburbs around the cities given to the Levites?
options: One thousand cubits from the city wall
Two thousand cubits from the city wall
Five hundred cubits from the city wall
Three thousand cubits from the city wall
questions.correctAnswer: One thousand cubits from the city wall
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:4 commands that the suburbs of the cities given to the Levites shall extend one thousand cubits from the city wall. This boundary provided space for livestock and goods, showing God's provision for the Levites who served Him (Leviticus 25:32-34, Ezra 2:70, Nehemiah 11:3).

questions.question: In Numbers 35, what consequence is stated for a person who kills another with enmity or by laying in wait?
options: They shall surely be put to death as a murderer
They shall be exiled indefinitely
They shall pay a ransom to the victim’s family
They shall be forgiven if they repent
questions.correctAnswer: They shall surely be put to death as a murderer
questions.explanation: Verses 20-21 state that if a person kills another out of hatred or by lying in wait, he is a murderer and shall be put to death. This highlights God's justice and the sanctity of life (Genesis 9:6, Exodus 21:12, Matthew 5:21-22, Romans 13:4).

questions.question: How many cities in total were given to the Levites including the cities of refuge, according to Numbers 35?
options: Forty-eight cities
Forty-two cities
Six cities
Fifty-four cities
questions.correctAnswer: Forty-eight cities
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:7 states that the total number of cities given to the Levites was forty-eight, which includes the six cities of refuge. This distribution reflects God's orderly provision for the priestly tribe (Joshua 21:1-42, 1 Chronicles 6:54-81).

questions.question: What was required before a murderer could be put to death, based on the law given in Numbers 35?
options: The testimony of two or three witnesses
The confession of the murderer
The decision of the high priest alone
The payment of a ransom
questions.correctAnswer: The testimony of two or three witnesses
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:30 commands that a murderer be put to death only by the testimony of witnesses, emphasizing the principle of just and fair judgment (Deuteronomy 17:6, Deuteronomy 19:15, Matthew 18:16, 2 Corinthians 13:1).

questions.question: What happens to a slayer who flees to a city of refuge but leaves its boundaries before the death of the high priest?
options: The avenger of blood may kill him without guilt
He remains safe and cannot be harmed
He must pay a penalty to the congregation
He is exiled from Israel
questions.correctAnswer: The avenger of blood may kill him without guilt
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:26-27 declare that if the slayer leaves the city of refuge before the high priest’s death, the avenger may kill him without guilt. This shows the seriousness of abiding by God's ordinance and the protection granted until the atoning death of the high priest, symbolizing ultimate atonement (Hebrews 7:23-28, Leviticus 16:34).

questions.question: According to Numbers 35, why must the land not be polluted with innocent blood?
options: Because blood defiles the land and requires blood for cleansing
Because it would cause famine and drought
Because it displeases the kings of the land
Because it breaks the Sabbath command
questions.correctAnswer: Because blood defiles the land and requires blood for cleansing
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:33 states that the land is defiled by bloodshed and can only be cleansed by the blood of the one who shed it, showing the holiness of the land and the demand for justice (Genesis 4:10-12, Leviticus 17:11, Ezekiel 36:18-19, Hebrews 9:22).

questions.question: What does Numbers 35 teach about God's presence in relation to the land of Israel?
options: God dwells among His people in the land and commands it not be defiled
God only dwells in the temple in Jerusalem
God is distant and uninvolved with the land
God’s presence is only in the heavens
questions.correctAnswer: God dwells among His people in the land and commands it not be defiled
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:34 reveals that God dwells in the land among Israel and commands the land not be defiled by bloodshed, highlighting God's holiness and covenant relationship with His people (Exodus 25:8, Leviticus 26:11-12, Psalm 132:13-14, John 1:14).

questions.question: How were the cities to be given to the Levites, according to the inheritance of the children of Israel?
options: In proportion to the size of each family's possession
Equally distributed regardless of inheritance
Only from the northern tribes
Only from the tribes of Judah and Benjamin
questions.correctAnswer: In proportion to the size of each family's possession
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:8 instructs that the children of Israel were to give cities to the Levites from their inheritance proportionally according to how much they inherited, showing fairness in the distribution of land (Deuteronomy 16:18, Joshua 13-21, 1 Chronicles 23:4-5).

questions.question: What is the theological significance of the cities of refuge as foreshadowed in the New Testament?
options: They symbolize Christ as the ultimate refuge for sinners
They represent the kingdom of Israel’s military power
They illustrate the need for ritual purity laws
They demonstrate the importance of tribal leadership
questions.correctAnswer: They symbolize Christ as the ultimate refuge for sinners
questions.explanation: The cities of refuge in Numbers 35 prefigure Christ who is our refuge and advocate, offering protection from judgment for sinners (Hebrews 6:18-20, Psalm 46:1, Matthew 11:28-30, Romans 8:1). This typology teaches God’s mercy and justice united in salvation.

questions.question: What role does the 'avenger of blood' play according to Numbers 35?
options: To execute judgment on a murderer who kills with intent
To grant forgiveness to manslayers
To advocate for the accused in court
To oversee the distribution of land
questions.correctAnswer: To execute judgment on a murderer who kills with intent
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:19 and 35:21 describe the avenger of blood as the person responsible for killing a murderer who acted with malice, illustrating God's justice and the seriousness of premeditated murder (Genesis 4:15, Deuteronomy 19:12-13, Romans 13:4).

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the legal distinction made in Numbers 35 regarding types of killing?
options: Intentional murder is punished by death, accidental killing allows refuge
All killing is treated equally and punished by death
Only killing during war is punished
Killing by natural causes is punishable
questions.correctAnswer: Intentional murder is punished by death, accidental killing allows refuge
questions.explanation: Numbers 35 differentiates between murder (intentional killing) which requires capital punishment, and manslaughter (unintentional killing) which allows refuge, emphasizing God's justice tempered with mercy (Exodus 21:12-14, Deuteronomy 19:4-6, Matthew 5:21-22).

questions.question: According to Numbers 35, what happens after the death of the high priest in relation to the cities of refuge?
options: The manslayer may return to his possession in the land
The cities of refuge are abolished
The manslayer must remain in exile forever
The manslayer is required to pay a fine
questions.correctAnswer: The manslayer may return to his possession in the land
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:28 explains that after the death of the high priest, the manslayer is allowed to return to his land, symbolizing the completion of atonement and restoration, which connects to the New Testament understanding of Christ’s priesthood (Hebrews 7:23-28, 9:11-15).

questions.question: What does Numbers 35 reveal about the sanctity of human life in God's law?
options: Human life is sacred and unlawful killing demands just punishment
Human life is less important than property rights
Only the lives of priests are protected
Killing is permissible without consequence
questions.correctAnswer: Human life is sacred and unlawful killing demands just punishment
questions.explanation: Throughout Numbers 35 (e.g., verses 16-21, 30-31), the law emphasizes the sacredness of life and prescribes just penalties for unlawful killing, reflecting God's holiness and justice (Genesis 1:27, Exodus 20:13, Psalm 139:13-16, Matthew 19:18).

questions.question: How does Numbers 35 instruct the congregation to act between the slayer and the avenger of blood?
options: The congregation shall judge between them and protect the slayer if innocent
The congregation must always side with the avenger
The congregation is to remain neutral and uninvolved
The congregation should banish both parties
questions.correctAnswer: The congregation shall judge between them and protect the slayer if innocent
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:24-25 commands the congregation to judge between the slayer and the avenger, delivering the slayer if innocent to the city of refuge, demonstrating God's justice administered by the community (Deuteronomy 19:12-13, Proverbs 31:8-9, Acts 6:3-6).

questions.question: What does Numbers 35 teach about the relationship between justice and mercy?
options: Justice is executed for intentional murder while mercy provides refuge for accidental killing
Mercy overrides justice in all cases
Justice rejects mercy entirely
Mercy is only for the priests
questions.correctAnswer: Justice is executed for intentional murder while mercy provides refuge for accidental killing
questions.explanation: The chapter balances justice (death for murder) with mercy (cities of refuge for manslayers), reflecting God’s righteous character and His provision for sinners (Psalm 89:14, Micah 6:8, Romans 12:19, James 2:13).

questions.question: What theological truth about God's judgment is emphasized by the requirement of multiple witnesses before condemning someone to death in Numbers 35?
options: God's judgment requires fairness and evidence to avoid wrongful death
God accepts accusations without proof
God's judgment is arbitrary
Witnesses are not necessary if the accused confesses
questions.correctAnswer: God's judgment requires fairness and evidence to avoid wrongful death
questions.explanation: Numbers 35:30's requirement of multiple witnesses reflects God's justice and fairness, preventing false accusations and wrongful executions (Deuteronomy 19:15, John 8:17, 2 Corinthians 13:1, Revelation 11:3).
